questions.question: Given that: $$ I = \int_1^2 \int_0^1 e^{(x+y)} \times dx \times dy $$. Find the value of Integration of Y with Double Integration Trapazoidal Rule.

Given that: $$ I = \int_1^2 \int_0^1 e^{(x+y)} \times dx \times dy $$. x1 = 0, x2 = 1, y1 = 1, y2 = 2, number of divisions in x direction is n = 2 and number of divisions in y direction is m = 2. Find the value of h<sub>x</sub> and h<sub>y</sub> used Double Integration Trapazoidal Rule.
